body_html: It seems to me you can simply use a placeholder with undefined shape at least this is what I am doing and it works: x=tf.placeholder(tf.float32,[None,None,None,3],name="input_network"). Not very memory efficient I suppose but it works.
body_text: It seems to me you can simply use a placeholder with undefined shape at least this is what I am doing and it works:  x=tf.placeholder(tf.float32,[None,None,None,3],name="input_network"). Not very memory efficient I suppose but it works.
body: It seems to me you can simply use a placeholder with undefined shape at least this is what I am doing and it works:  x=tf.placeholder(tf.float32,[None,None,None,3],name="input_network"). Not very memory efficient I suppose but it works.
